732078f-a.text:
Quarantine N.Y.

July 17, 1912.
Every precaution is being taken by the federal health officials to prevent bubonic plague from getting into this country. Experiments of methods for preventing and fighting the dread disease are now being carried on at Quarantine, New York harbor. The picture shows doctors inoculating a guinea pig with bubonic plague germs.

Laboratory on Hoffman Island.

Photo-News Department
American Press Association
225 to 229 West 39th St., N.Y.
732078f-a.title: Islands - Hoffman Island - Laboratory.

732078f-b.text:

July 17, 1912.
Every precaution is being taken by the federal health officials to prevent bubonic plague from getting into this country. Experiments of methods for preventing and fighting the dread disease are now being carried on at Quarantine, New York harbor. The picture shows doctors inoculating a guinea pig with bubonic plague germs.

Laboratory on Hoffman Island.

Photo-News Department
American Press Association
225 to 229 West 39th St., N.Y.
732078f-b.title: Islands - Hoffman Island - Laboratory.

732079f-a.text:
(1)
Hoffman Island, in the Lower New York Bay, seen from the lower end of South Beach, at Ocean Breeze, Staten Island. It is an artificial island constructed in 1872 by the New York State Quarantine Service for the detention and purification of well persons arriving in infected vessels. In 1938 the island was reconditioned for use by the Training School of the United States Maritime Service, which prepares trained seamen under the supervision of the United States Coast Guard.

June 16, 1925
P. L. Sperr

(2) and (3)
Two views at a later date. On the horizon is visible the shore of Coney Island, Brooklyn.

August 25, 1929
P. L. Sperr
732079f-a.title: Islands - Hoffman Island - [Lower New York Bay.]

732085f-a.text:
View of Administration Building Quarantine.

Hoffman Island, off Quarantine, Staten Island, New York, to which the cholera suspects [are taken]. Cases of infectious disease are taken to Swinburne Island, which is nearby.

From Photo-News Department
American Press Association
225 West 39th St., N.Y.
